victims.name: Stephane Albertini
victims.bio: Stephane Albertini operated a popular Italian restaurant in Neuilly-sur-Scene with his cousin, Pierre Innocenti. Both were killed at the Bataclan concert.

victims.name: Nick Alexander
victims.bio: Nick Alexander lived in Colchester, England, and sold merchandise for the band Eagles of Death Metal, which was performing at Bataclan. Alexander was killed at the concert hall.

victims.name: Amine Ibnolmobarak
victims.bio: Amine Ibnolmobarak was newly marrried and was on the bar's terrace with his wife Maya when shooting started. He was killed, she was critically wounded. He was an architect and teacher at ENSA Paris-Malaquais architecture school and worked in Paris.

victims.name: Thomas Ayad
victims.bio: Thomas Ayad was originally from Amiens, France. He was an executive for Mercury Records, the French division of Universal Music Group, the label of Eagles of Death Metal. Ayad and two friends were killed at the concert.

victims.name: Maxime Bouffard
victims.bio: Maxime Bouffard was a film director.

victims.name: Quentin Boulanger
victims.bio: Quentin Boulenger graduated from the Audencia School of Management in Nantes, France. He lived in Paris.

victims.name: Ludovic Boumbas
victims.bio: Ludovic Boumbas died shielding a female friend, who survived, when the shooting started at the La Belle Equipe restaurant. They were there to celebrate a friend's birthday. Boumbas was born in Congo and grew up in Lille, France. He worked at FedEx.

victims.name: Elodie Breuli
victims.bio: Elodie Breuil was a design student at Ecole de Conde in Paris. She had traveled from Boulogne to attend the concert with friends.

victims.name: Clair Camax
victims.bio: Clair Camax was killed at the concert hall; her husband Laurent survived. They have two children. With a degree in graphic arts, she started a design business for websites. She loved drawing, painting, comic books and rock music.

victims.name: Ciprian Calciu
victims.bio: Ciprian Calciu and Mariana Lacramioara Pop, his girlfriend, were killed by an outdoor shooter. They met in Paris after migrating there separately. They had one young son together; she also had a 11-year-old daughter. He repaired elevators.

victims.name: Nicolas Classeau
victims.bio: Nicolas Classeau was director at the Institut Universitaire de Technologie in Marne-la-Vallee. He had three children,all under the age of 16.

victims.name: Manuel Dias
victims.bio: Manuel Dias was a driver for Regnault Autocars when he was killed outside the sports stadium by a suicide bomber. Originally from Portugal, he had a wife and children and had lived in Paris for 45 years. That night, he brought a few customers to see the soccer game, but stayed outside to call his wife on a cellphone. His wife was on another line with their daughter and said she would call him back. After that, his wife could only reach his voicemail.

victims.name: Precilia Correia
victims.bio: Precilia Correia was killed with Manu Perez, her boyfriend, at the concert hall. She worked at a Paris electronics store. She was born in Paris; her father was Portuguese and her mother was French.

victims.name: Aurelie De Peretti
victims.bio: Aurelie de Peretti was a graphic designer and also worked at beach resort in St. Tropez. She loved music and went to Paris with a friend to attend the concert.

victims.name: Guillaume Decherf
victims.bio: Guillaume Decherf was a music writer for Les Inrockuptibles (Les Inrocks). He was the father of two daughters and was a former student at Loughborough University in England.

victims.name: Alban Denuit
victims.bio: Alban Denuit was an artist and earned his doctorate from the National School of Fine Arts in Paris. He taught visual arts at University of Bordeaux-Montaigne.

victims.name: Asta Diakite
victims.bio: Asta Diakite was killed at a restaurant. She was in Paris to watch her cousin play soccer and had gone shopping earlier that day with a nephew.

victims.name: Romain Didier
victims.bio: Romain Didier and Lamia Mondeguer were killed at the La Belle Equipe bar. They had been dating for four months. He was originally from Sancerre, a wine-making region of France. An amateur rugby player, he lived in Paris, where he was studying drama.

victims.name: Lucie Dietrich
victims.bio: Lucie Dietrich was a Paris-based jewelry and graphic designer. She was shot in a drive-by shooting by a terrorist on Rue de la Fontaine au Roi.

victims.name: Elif Dogan
victims.bio: Elif Dogan was killed with her partner Milki Jozic at the pizzeria. They had been together for four months. She was from a Turkish family and was raised in Liege.

victims.name: Fabrice DuBois
victims.bio: Fabrice DuBois married with two children. He was a publicist and design editor for Publicis Conseil.

victims.name: Romain Dunet
victims.bio: Romain Dunet was an English teacher at a Paris high school and taught French in New Zealand in 2013. He was also a musician who played pop-rock tunes in Paris cafes and bars on open-mic nights.

victims.name: Thomas Duperron
victims.bio: Thomas Duperron was the communications director for the Maronquinerie Theater. He was raised in Alencon and lived in Paris.

victims.name: Mathias Dymarski
victims.bio: Mathias Dymarski and Marie Lausch, his girlfriend, were killed at the concert. He was a competitive BMX bike rider.

victims.name: Germain Ferey
victims.bio: Germain Ferey attended the concert with his partner and family members. He was killed after being separated from them when the attack began. His partner survived; they have a daughter, 17 months old. Ferey was a video producer and an audiovisual illustrator.

victims.name: Romain Feuillade
victims.bio: Romain Feuillade ran the Les Cent Kilos restaurant in Paris. He was also an aspiring actor.

victims.name: Gregory Fosse
victims.bio: Gregory Fosse was a music programmer for TV station D17. He was from town of Gambais in Ill-de-France.

victims.name: Alberto Gonzalez Garrido
victims.bio: Alberto Gonzalez Garrido was recently married. He was an engineer for the Spanish broadcaster TVE and had been living in Paris for two years.

victims.name: Suzon Garrigues
victims.bio: Suzon Garrigues was in her third year of studying modern literature at the Sorbonne. Emile Zola was one of her favorite writers.

victims.name: Veronica Geoffrey de Bourgies
victims.bio: Veronique Geoffroy de Bourgies was the mother of two adopted children from Madagascar. She was a former journalist for 'Madame Figaro' and 'Vogue Homme.' She founded and operated the Zazakely Sambatry, a humanitarian charity for children.

victims.name: Michelli Gil Jaimez
victims.bio: Michelli Gil Jaimez grew up in Tuxpan area of Mexico. She lived in Paris for 8 years and held Spain citizenship. She was due to be married in a few weeks

victims.name: Matthieu Giroud
victims.bio: Matthieu Giroud is the father of 3-year-old child. His wife is pregnant. He was a geography lecturer at University of Paris-Est Marne-la-Vallee.

victims.name: Cedric Gomet
victims.bio: Cedric Gomet worked for TV5 Monde. He was a guitarist and fan of rock music.

victims.name: Nohemi Gonzalez
victims.bio: Nohemi Gonzalez was a senior at California State University, Long Beach. She was an exchange student living in Paris.

victims.name: Anne Guyomard
victims.bio: Anne Cornet Guyomard and her husband Pierre-Yves Guyomard were killed at the concert hall. She was a former student of her husband before they married. She worked in pediatric nursing.

victims.name: Pierre-Yves Guyomard
victims.bio: Pierre-Yves Guyomard and his wife Anne were killed at the concert hall. He taught sound engineering at a technical college.

victims.name: Pierre-Antonie Henry
victims.bio: Pierre-Antonie Henry was an engineer and the father of two young daughters.

victims.name: Raphael Hilz
victims.bio: Raphael Hilz was an architect from Paris, originally from Garmisch-Partenkirchen in Germany. He was having dinner at a restaurant when he was killed.

victims.name: Mathieu Hoche
victims.bio: Mathieu Hoche was a technician for France 24 news channel. He has a 6-year-old child.

victims.name: Djamila Houd
victims.bio: Djamila Houd was killed in front of her husband Gregory in the restaurant attack. She worked for Isabel Marant, a fashion house.

victims.name: Pierre Innocenti
victims.bio: Pierre Innocenti and his cousin Stephane Albertinian ran Chez Livio, a popular Italian restaurant in Neuilly-sur-Scene. Both died at the concert.

victims.name: Milko Jozic
victims.bio: Milko Jozic and his girlfriend Elif Dogan were killed at the pizzeria. He was an industrial engineer, originally from Liege, France. He has a daughter in her 20s.

victims.name: Hyacinthe Koma
victims.bio: Hyacinthe Koma was celebrating birthday of Halima Saadi, who also died at La Belle Equipe. Koma worked as a server at Les Chic Types.

victims.name: Mariana Lacramiora Pop
victims.bio: Mariana Lacramiora Pop and her partner Ciprian Calciu were killed outside the café. They were celebrating at a birthday party when the attack started. They have one young son together; she also has a daughter.

victims.name: Marie Lausch
victims.bio: Marie Lausch and her boyfriend Mathias Dyrmaski died at the concert. They were together for five years. She worked in international public relations at Coty and was preparing to graduate from the NEOMA Business School in France.

victims.name: Guillaume Le Dramp
victims.bio: Guillaume Le Dramp was celebrating his 33rd birthday at the bar at the time of the attack. He worked in Paris as bartender.

victims.name: Renaud Le Guen
victims.bio: Renaud Le Guen was the service adviser at Man Truck and Bus France. He loved jazz and rock music, and planned to marry his partner of 12 years next year.

victims.name: Gilles Leclerc
victims.bio: Gilles Leclerc attended the concert with his girlfriend, who survived.He was a florist in Saint-Leula-Foret.

victims.name: Christophe Lellouche
victims.bio: Christophe Lellouche was one of music composers for film "Yung Forever." He was also a guitarist and vocalist for Olivier, an independent pop band, and an avid soccer fan.

victims.name: Antoine Mary
victims.bio: Antoine Mary was a computer programmer and developer, and recently began a freelance career.

victims.name: Cedric Mauduit
victims.bio: Cedric Mauduit is the father of two children and was a council member from Calavados in Normandy. Friends have asked his music idols David Bowie and the Rolling Stones to attend his funeral.

victims.name: Fanny Minot
victims.bio: Fanny Minot was an editor at Canal + Supplement.

victims.name: Lamia Mondeguer
victims.bio: Lamia Mondeguer and Romain Didier were killed at the La Belle Equipe bar. They had been dating for four months. Mondeguer, a dual Egyptian-French national, was a graduate of a Paris film school and was head of actors in the Noma Talents agency, where she worked for five years.

victims.name: Marie Mosser
victims.bio: Marie Mosser was a Universal Music Group digital marketing specialist. She spent last two summers in Brighton studying English.

victims.name: Justine Moulin
victims.bio: Justine Moulin was having dinner with friends when she was killed. She was planning to visit her family in Nieppe on the next weekend.

victims.name: Quentin Mourier
victims.bio: Quentin Mourier was an architect at Atelier Grand Paris.

victims.name: Victor Munoz
victims.bio: Victor Munoz was a student at the Paris School of Business. He loved travel and lived in Prague for a time.

victims.name: Helene Muyal-Leiris
victims.bio: Helene Muyal-Leiris was a make-up artist on fashion shoots. She was married with one child.

victims.name: Bertrand Navarret
victims.bio: Bertrand Navarret was a carpenter and avid surfer. He attended the concert during a weekend trip to Paris.

victims.name: Patricia San Martin
victims.bio: Witnesses said Elsa Delplace and her mother, Patricia San Martin, both died shielding her five-year-old son Louis from attackers' gunfire at the concert hall.

victims.name: David Perchirin
victims.bio: David Perchirin was a former journalist who became an elementary school teacher.  He started work in the Seine Saint Denis area of Paris in September 2014.

victims.name: Manu Perez
victims.bio: Manu Perez worked for the Universal Music Group.

victims.name: Marion Petard Lieffrieg
victims.bio: Marion Lieffrig-Petard and her sister Anna were killed at Le Petit Cambodge restaurant. Marion was a music student studying for a master's degree at the Sorbonne. She planned to do her second year of study in Italy.

victims.name: Anna Petard Lieffrieg
victims.bio: Anna Lieffrig-Petard and her sister Marion were killed at Le Petit Cambodge restaurant. Anna was a graphic designer for Reporters Without Borders.

victims.name: Caroline Prenat
victims.bio: Caroline Prenat was a graphic designer from Lyon.

victims.name: Francois-Xavier Prevost
victims.bio: Francois-Xavier Prevost was the advertising chief for LocalMedia.

victims.name: Sebastien Proisy
victims.bio: Sebastien Proisy was a graduate of Ecole de Guerre Economique and recently started his own company.

victims.name: Armelle Pumir Anticevic
victims.bio: Armelle Pumir Anticevic was the print production manager at Logic Design Agency.

victims.name: Valentin Ribet
victims.bio: Valentin Ribet was a graduate of London School of Economics and a lawyer with the Paris branch of Hogan Lovells.

victims.name: Estelle Rouat
victims.bio: Estelle Rouat was an English teacher at Gay-Lussac college in Colombes.

victims.name: Thibault Rousse Lacordaire
victims.bio: Thibault Rousse Lacordaire was a financial controller for Colony Capital.

victims.name: Halima Saadi
victims.bio: Halima Saadi and her sister Houda were killed at La Belle Equipe restaurant. She was visiting Paris for a week from her home in Dakar, Senegal.

victims.name: Houda Saadi
victims.bio: Houda Saadi and her sister Halima were killed at La Belle Equipe restaurant. She was the manager of the restaurant.

victims.name: Kheirddine Sahbi
victims.bio: Kheirddine Sahbi was killed in a street shooting while walking home. He was a student at the Sorbonne, studying violin.

victims.name: Lola Salines
victims.bio: Lola Salines was a member of Roller Derby team Le Boucherie de Paris.

victims.name: Elsa Delplace
victims.bio: Witnesses said Elsa Delplace and her mother, Patricia San Martin, both died shielding her five-year-old son Louis from attackers' gunfire at the concert hall.

victims.name: Hugo Sarrade
victims.bio: Hugo Sarrade was a student in Montpellier and was passionate about rock music and computers.

victims.name: Maud Serrault
victims.bio: Maud Serrault and her husband were at the concert hall when the attacks began. She was killed; he survived. They were recently married. She was director of marketing and e-commerce for Best Western France.

victims.name: Valeria Solesin
victims.bio: Valeria Solesin was a researcher and doctoral student at Sorbonne. A resident of Venice, she attended the concert with boyfriend.

victims.name: Fabian Stech
victims.bio: Fabian Stech was married and the father of two children. He was born in Hannover and was an art critic and translator. He taught at a private art school in Dijon and worked for a German art magazine.

victims.name: Arianne Theiller
victims.bio: Arianne Theiller attended the University of Strasbourg and was an intern for Urban Comics.

victims.name: Luis Felipe Zschoche Valle
victims.bio: Luis Felipe Zschoche Valle was born in Chile. He was a singer and guitarist for the band Captain Americano and had lived in Paris for 8 years with French wife.

victims.name: Salah Emad al-Jabali
victims.bio: Salah Emad al-Jabali was an Egyptian national who died in the attacks.

victims.name: Eric Thome
victims.bio: Eric Thome was a photographer and the art director of We Are Ted, a graphic design company.

victims.name: Jean-Jacques Amiot
victims.bio: Jean-Jacques Amiot was a photographer and operated his own printing company prior to retirement last year.

victims.name: Chloe Boissinot
victims.bio: Chloe Boissinot and her boyfriend were at a restaurant when the attack began. She was killed, he survived. She came to Paris two years ago and was working in a pub. She also attended school in Chateau-Larcher in France, where she was studying management.

victims.name: Emmanuel Bonnet
victims.bio: Emmanuel Bonnet was a railway worker from Chapelle-en-Serval north of Paris.

victims.name: Baptiste Chevreau
victims.bio: Baptiste Chevreau moved to Paris from Tonnerre in central France in September. He was a music illustrator.

copy.credits: George Petras, Ramon Padilla, Mitchell Thorson, USA TODAY
copy.chatter: Nearly 130 people died in the Islamic State terrorist attacks in Paris on Nov. 13. The stories of their deaths are heartbreaking, compelling – and in some cases, heroic. Click on the names below to learn more. USA TODAY will add names and update these stories as more information becomes available.
